channel.title: Haskell Daily Notes on WY Computer Science
channel.description: Recent content in Haskell Daily Notes on WY Computer Science

item.description: Memorize how to write a basic main method: main = do putStrLn "Loaded" Use “–” (two dashes) to comment to the end of the line. This is equivalent to Racket “;” (semicolon). Function name rules: Must begin with lowercase letter. Hyphens (-) are not allowed in names. Underscore (_) may be used instead. Traditionally camelCase is used for functions. (First letter lowercase, then uppercase each new word.
removeVowels word = [ letter | letter <- word, not (letter elem “aeiouAEIOU” )] wordLenPairs wordlist = [ (word, length word) | word <- wordlist ]
